result.execSummary:
The defendant was charged with both Operating w/ PAC (9th) and OWI ( 9th). The defendant was found guilty of Operating w/ PAC (9th) and the other charge, OWI ( 9th) was dismissed by the court.

  • Dean T Schaefer was found guilty of Operating w/ PAC (9th), a class G felony, Wisconsin Statutes 346.63(1)(b).

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

supervisions.notes: Fine of $2,000.00 plus the DNA surcharge, costs and disbursements. To be taken by DOC from upo to 25% of prison funds. Balance to be paid while on Extended supervision.  Failure to pay amounts in full would result in a civil judgment entered against defendant.

superMiscConds.notes: Seek and maintain employment.  Be given job and vocational training.
AODA assessment and treatment.  Urine screens.  No controlled substances or alcohol.  Urine screens.

supervisions.notes: Court Order for IDP Related Offense Driver Assessment and Driver Safety Plan signed and filed.

Provide DNA sample if not previously taken.
Court advised defendant that as a convicted felon not to possess any firearms; further advised defendant of voting ineligibility.

records.addlTxt:
Amendment to Judgment of Conviction and Order - ERP, signed, filed, and distributed.
IT IS ORDERED that the Department of Corrections will effectuate the change from Confinement to Extended Supervision, determining the actual number of days served in Confinement and changing the remaining Confinement to Extended Supervision. The number of days will be determined by Department of Corrections Records Office staff and will be based upon actual release date. 
IT IS FURTHER ORDERED that the Warden/Superintendent of the institution to which the defendant is assigned shall effect the defendant's release within 6 working days upon receipt of this order.
DOC is requesting the Court to authorize the inmate's release and conversion of remaining confinement time to extended supervision.  Assigned to Br. 20  Judge Wall. os

records.addlTxt: Associated with Charge #2
Arguments heard as to bail.  Court set bail at $10,000.00 CASH.

Attorney Jamie Francis Cimpl-Wiemer in court, defendant Dean T Schaefer not in court, in custody.  Deann L Heard appeared on behalf of Kimberly D. Schoepp for the State of Wisconsin.  Defense counsel waived his client's appearance.  Defendant returned on the warrant.  Defense counsel requested plea and sentencing date; file retained in court.  Plea/sentencing hearing scheduled for April 22, 2015 at 01:30 pm.
Bench warrant cleared by Milwaukee County Sheriff on 4-08-2015. Bench Warrant in file.  Case is adjourned for return on bench warrant in Branch 20.

Defendant Dean T Schaefer not in court.  Alex T. Mueller appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Deputy court clerk cmt.
Bail Forfeiture Hearing proceeds.  In Court by telephone is Surety, Lisa S.  Statements made by both parties.  Court orders bail/bond to remain forfeited.
Surety, Lisa S. cannot be in court on 3/6/15.  She would like to receive a phone call between 9 a.m. to 11 a.m. Telephone number is 414-807-8813.
Case is scheduled for BAIL/BOND FORFEITURE HEARING ON 03-06-2015 at 9:00 a.m. before Judge Jeffrey Kremers. Notices mailed to defendant and surety.

Surety called this day to request rescheduling of BF Hearing. 2015 dates have not yet been established. Once those dates have been determined, reschedule Surety for March 2015 hearing and send applicable notice.
Case is scheduled for BAIL/BOND FORFEITURE HEARING ON 12-19-14 at 9:00 a.m. before Judge Jeffrey Kremers. Notices mailed to defendant and surety.
Notice of bail/bond forfeiture mailed to surety and defendant; Original in file. ($2,500.00) ad
COURT ORDERED DEFENDANT REMANDED TO THE JUDGE ON RETURN OF THE BENCH WARRANT.

Attorney Jamie Francis Cimpl-Wiemer in court.  Kimberly Dorice Schoepp appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Defendant failing to appear, Court ordered a bench warrant to be issued.  State's motion for Judgment of Bond Forfeiture 30 days after notification from Clerk of Circuit Court's Office is granted by the Court.  Court makes findings that there is no possible victim identified therefore recompense is not an issue.
WCS report received and filed.
/from WCS, filed.

Amended Information filed.  Copy given to defense counsel who waived reading.  Defendant pled not guilty.  Court ordered all terms and conditions of bail to continue and continued Branch 20 for jury trial.
State filed an amended Information, adding Count 2:  Operating with Prohibited Alcohol Concentration - 7th , 8th or 9th Offense, a Class G Felony, contrary to Wis. Stats. section 346.63)1)(b).

Defendant Dean T Schaefer in court with attorney Jamie Francis Cimpl-Wiemer.  Kimberly Dorice Schoepp appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Defense counsel advised the Court his client no longer qualifies for Public Defender representation.  Court denied any motion to withdraw and ordered defendant to pay the Public Defender's Office and have Attorney Cimpl-Wiemer continue on as counsel of record.  Final pretrial held.  Case remains in trial posture.
/from WCS, filed.

Defendant Dean T Schaefer in court with attorney Jamie Francis Cimpl-Wiemer.  Kimberly Dorice Schoepp appeared via telephone for the State of Wisconsin.  Confirmation report submitted from the Lab to WCS; copies provided to defense counsel and ADA Schoepp.  Court finds that based upon the lab results, defendant is not in violation of conditions of bail.  Court ordered all terms and conditions of bail to continue and ordered case continued before Branch 20 for final pretrial on 8/08/14 at 8:30 a.m.

Defendant Dean T Schaefer in court with attorney Jamie Francis Cimpl-Wiemer.  Jay R. Pucek appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Case in court for WCS hearing on bail.  Per Ms. Bauer of WCS, results of challenged test not yet received.  Court ordered all terms and conditions of bail to continue and continued matter before Branch 20.  Bail hearing scheduled for July 25, 2014 at 01:30 pm.
Violation report, received and filed.

Defendant Dean T Schaefer in court with attorney Jamie F Cimpl-Wiemer.  James W Frisch appeared on behalf of Kimberly D. Schoepp for the State of Wisconsin.  Entry made without file.  WCS caseworker:  Ms. Cherie Bauer. Defendant tested positive for codeine; Court advised that he wants to pay for a re-test.   Court granted defendant's request and ordered all terms and conditions of bail to continue.  Bail/bond hearing scheduled for July 21, 2014 at 08:30 am.

Defendant Dean T Schaefer in court with attorney Jamie F Cimpl-Wiemer.  James W Frisch appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Deputy court clerk:  vk  Court ordered case adjourned for final pretrial and jury trial in Branch 20.  Defense motions due by 7-7-2014, state's response due by 7-22-2014 and any defense reply due by 7-28-2014.  Motions in limine, proposed jury instructions and witness lists due by 8-4-2011.  Bail conditions remains as ordered.  Final pre-trial scheduled for August 11, 2014 at 08:30 am.  Jury trial scheduled for August 25, 2014 at 08:30 am.
WCS report, received and filed

Defendant Dean T Schaefer in court with attorney Jamie F Cimpl-Wiemer.  Kimberly D Schoepp appeared for the State of Wisconsin.   Deputy court clerk: LMS.

Court reviews the report and finds the defendant in compliance.  Defense request additional discovery and is requesting an adjourned scheduling conference to review documents.  Scheduling conference scheduled for June 18, 2014 at 01:30 pm.

Defendant Dean T Schaefer in court with attorney Jamie F Cimpl-Wiemer.  Kimberly D Schoepp appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Parties request another date as they are awaiting blood results.  Court granted request and ordered all terms and conditions of bail to continue.  WCS report reviewed; defendant compliant; Court ordered defendant to report to Justice Point after court today.  Scheduling conference scheduled for May 30, 2014 at 08:30 am.

Defendant Dean T Schaefer in court with attorney Jamie F Cimpl-Wiemer.  Kimberly D Schoepp appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  
Preliminary hearing proceeded.  Sworn for the state:Megan Tomaszewski-Greenfield Police Department Officer.  State rests.  Defense rests.  Defense motion to dismiss argued and denied. Scheduling conference scheduled for May 15, 2014 at 08:30 am.

Defendant Dean T Schaefer in court with attorney Jamie F Cimpl-Wiemer.  Defendant Dean T Schaefer in custody.  David Robles appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Deputy court clerk:  hgj.  Defendant given a copy of complaint and advised of maximum penalties, right to counsel and right to a preliminary hearing.  Court reviewed complaint and found probable cause to hold defendant for further proceedings.  DEFENDANT IS INDIGENT AND PUBLIC DEFENDER WILL PROVIDE COUNSEL.  Defendant is advised this case is assigned to Judge MORONEY, Branch 20.  Case is adjourned for preliminary hearing in Branch PE.  Preliminary hearing scheduled for April 28, 2014 at 08:30 am.
